## Defence Construction Canada – Request for Proposals for Smart Building Program

### Project Overview

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites proposals from qualified firms to establish a Regional Standing Offer (SO) for the provision of services under the Smart Building Program in the Ontario Region.

### Project Details

*   **Project Number**: MP2016-79155
*   **.btnClose Closing Date**: May 4, 2023, 14:00:00 (ET)
*   **Project Duration**: 2 years with an option to extend for up to 3 additional 1-year periods
*   **Estimated Value**: $5,365,000.00

### Project Objectives

The objective of this Request for Proposals (RFP) is to select one contractor to sign a Regional Standing Offer (SO) with DCC to provide services on an “as and when required” basis to a maximum estimated value of $5,365,000.00 for a period of two years from the date of establishment. Call-ups under the SO are expected to be valued between $100,000.00 and $750,000.00. If mutually agreeable between the contractor and DDC, the SO may be extended for up to three (3) additional one (1) year periods and increased in the order of $765,000.00 for each additional period.

### Security Requirements

The security requirements for this project are identified in the RFP documents. All solicitation documents, including the RFP, are available on the MERX electronic bidding system.

### Eligibility and Qualification

Eligible firms must have experience in providing similar services and meet the specified technical and security requirements outlined in the RFP documents.

### Evaluations and Awards

Proposals will be evaluated using the established criteria in the RFP documents. The evaluation criteria include, but are not limited to, the contractor’s ability to meet the project’s objectives, technical expertise, and experience in providing similar services.

All firms interested in submitting a proposal for this project must do so through the MERX electronic bidding system on or before the closing date and time indicated on the system.

Further information about the contract award process can be obtained from Defence Construction Canada’s website.
